results.title: Mike Mulligan and his steam shovel
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Picture Book Parade”.
An iconographic film using the pictures and text of Virginia Lee Burton’s story of the steam shovel that defied obsolescence by becoming the furnace in the Popperville Town Hall. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.description:

results.title: Hush little baby
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Picture Book Parade”.
Family life in 18th century America is pictured with authenticity and charm in this enchanting animated rendition of the traditional folk lullaby. Illustrated and based on the book by Aliki.

results.title: The Circus baby
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Picture Book Parade”.
Tells the story of the mother elephant who learns that she should not try to get her baby to act like a human. Iconographic animation. From the book written and illustrated by Maud and Miska Petersham. Suitable for lower primary level.
results.description:

results.title: Rate for the job

results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Personnel Management”.
One of a series of five films attempting to clarify the personnel side of general management. Presented by Christopher Chataway.

results.title: Developing managerial talent
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Personnel Management”.
This film deals with the personnel side of management and enterprises where this function falls upon a particular manager. Discusses the recruiting and training of managers.

results.title: Man for the job
results.creator_credit: Margaret Smith, Gregory Clegg and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Personnel Management”.
Explains job analysis and techniques of ability testing, illustrated by two case studies of applications from the personnel manager’s point of view.

results.title: Supervisory conferences
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, Edward L. Gershman, Academy Productions and McGraw-Hill Text-Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”
Dramatised incidents in an industrial plant are used to show how conferences on the supervisory level lead to effective handling, training and utilisation of employees.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Art Babbitt, Edward L. Gershman, Academy Productions and McGraw-Hill Text-Films
